gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਤੳੁ ਅਸਟ ਧਾਤੂ ਡਾਰੀਅਤ ਨਾੳੁ ਬਿਖੈ ਪਾਰਿ ਪਰੈ ਤਾਹਿ ਤੳੂ ਵਾਰ ਪਾਰ ਸੋੲੀ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Tau Asat Dhaatoo Daareeat Naau Bikhai , Paari Parai Taahi Taoo Vaar Paar Soee Hai ?
translation: As a bundle of eight metals loaded in a boat will reach the other bank without any change in its form or colour during transit,

gurmukhi: ਸੋੲੀ ਧਾਤੁ ਅਗਨਿ ਮੈ ਹਤ ਹੈ ਅਨਿਕ ਰੂਪ ਤੳੂ ਜੋੲੀ ਸੋੲੀ ਪੈ ਸੁ ਘਾਟ ਠਾਟ ਹੋੲੀ ਹੈ
transliteration: Soee Dhaatu Agani Mai Hat Hai Anik Roopa , Taoo Joee Soee Pai Su Ghaat Tthaat Hoee Hai ?
translation: When these metals are put in fire, they melt and acquire the form of fire. It is then turned into beautiful ornaments of metal better looking than each individually.

gurmukhi: ਸੋੲੀ ਧਾਤੁ ਪਾਰਸਿ ਪਰਸ ਪੁਨਿ ਕੰਚਨ ਹੁੲਿ ਮੋਲ ਕੈ ਅਮੋਲਾਨੂਪ ਰੂਪ ਅਵਲੋੲੀ ਹੈ
transliteration: Soee Dhaatu Paarasi Paras Pouni Kanchan Hui , Mol Kai Amolaanoop Roop Avaloee Hai ?
translation: But when it comes in contact with philosopher-stone, it turns into gold. Beside becoming invaluable, it also becomes beautiful and attractive to look at.

gurmukhi: ਪਰਮ ਪਾਰਸ ਗੁਰ ਪਰਸਿ ਪਾਰਸ ਹੋਤ ਸੰਗਤਿ ਹੁੲਿ ਸਾਧਸੰਗ ਸਤਸੰਗ ਪੋੲੀ ਹੈ ॥੧੬੬॥
transliteration: Param Paaras Gur Parasi Paaras Hota , Sangati Hui Saadhasang Satasang Poee Hai ?166?
translation: Similarly in the company of God-oriented and holy men, one becomes holy. Meeting with True Guru, the Supreme of all philosopher-stones, one becomes like a philosopher-stone. (166)
